Model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Model.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model

    public class Game
extends java.util.Observable
implements Model
    This class keeps track of a game from start till finish.
    Author:
    peter, Stephan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(int turnInt)
      Makes a new Board class and saves it sets current Turn to 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int turnInt)
        Makes a new Board class and saves it sets current Turn to 1. Client needs it to be 2.

        public boolean isLegalMove(int column)

        Specified by:
        isLegalMove in interface Model
        Parameters:
        column - >= 0 && column <= 6

      • doMove

        public int doMove(int column,
                  int player)
        Places a stone in the given column for the given player if the move is legal and the player is on turn. Then checks if the board has a winner,draw, or no winner. Then changes the turn of the player. If 0 is returned then there the game can continue and the other player is on turn. If 1 is returned then the player has won. If 2 is returned then there is a draw.
        Specified by:
        doMove in interface Model
        Parameters:
        column - => 0 && column <= 6
        player - == 1 || player == 2

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        Sets the currentTurn variable to 2 when it is 1 and to 1 when it is 2 using modulo dividing on numberOfTurns.
